events.originalText: An earthquake struck the Indian state of Uttarakhand, killing at least 768 people and destroying thousands of homes.
events.subtitle: 1991 Uttarkashi earthquake
events.headline: Earthquake in Uttarakhand kills 768, destroys homes

events.originalText: Aeroflot Flight 6502 crashed on approach to Kurumoch Airport in Samara (then Kuibyshev in the Soviet Union), killing 70 people on board.
events.subtitle: Aeroflot Flight 6502
events.headline: Aeroflot Flight 6502 crashes in Samara, 70 dead

events.originalText: The Spanish trawler Sonia sank in British waters after a five-hour chase by the Irish Naval Service patrol vessel Aisling, during which almost 600 shots were fired.
events.subtitle: Sinking of the Spanish trawler Sonia
events.headline: Spanish trawler Sonia sinks after chase by Irish Naval Service

events.originalText: Watergate scandal: Both Attorney General Elliot Richardson and his deputy William Ruckelshaus resigned rather than obey Richard Nixon's order to have Archibald Cox fired.
events.subtitle: Watergate scandal
events.headline: Watergate scandal: Richardson and Ruckelshaus resign

events.originalText: Roger Patterson and Robert Gimlin filmed an unidentified subject, which they claimed was Bigfoot, at Six Rivers National Forest in California.
events.subtitle: Patterson–Gimlin film
events.headline: Bigfoot filmed in Six Rivers National Forest

events.originalText: African-American college football player Johnny Bright was the victim of an on-field assault, eventually leading to changes in NCAA football rules that mandated the use of more protective helmets with face guards.
events.subtitle: College football
events.headline: Assault on Johnny Bright leads to NCAA rule changes

events.originalText: World War II: Fulfilling a promise he made two years previously, General Douglas MacArthur landed on Leyte to begin the recapture of the Philippines.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: General MacArthur lands on Leyte to recapture Philippines

events.originalText: Pope Pius XII (pictured) published his first encyclical, Summi Pontificatus, which critiqued ideologies such as racism, cultural superiority and totalitarianism.
events.subtitle: Pope Pius XII
events.headline: Pope Pius XII critiques racism in first encyclical
